p:
Regarding the environment, differences were observed among the proportions of YFV-positive carcasses collected in urban (28.7%) urban-rural interface (35.8%), and rural areas (53.6%) ( x
2 = 44.65, p< 0.0001) ( Table 2). Analyses indicated a linear trend ( x
2 = 44.27, p< 0.0001) and higher odds ratio for detection of YFV from urban towards urban-rural interface (OR = 1.40) and rural areas (OR = 2.85) ( Table 2). The detection of YFV had a strong positive association with the rural environment and a strong negative association with the urban environment ( Fig 2C).
